description:
As a Strategy and Analytics Associate, you’ll work in close partnership with various teams to lead action-oriented analyses and provide regular insights, and at times reports, on performance and related trends. Projects might include applying statistical techniques to analyze organizational effectiveness, developing models to build our global resource planning model, or helping to define our technology roadmap. Above all else, you’ll focus on ensuring that our People Operations organization is well-informed and able to make thoughtful, data-driven decisions.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources"). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants and analysts, we're the advocates of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them" - we bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next great Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Business Administration, Computer Science, Finance, Statistics, related field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 6 years of relevant work experience in management consulting or business strategy.
  • Experience using quantitative and/or qualitative approaches to generate and translate insights into operational actions.
  • Experience working with spreadsheet software.

Preferred qualifications:

  • MBA or advanced degree.
  • Experience analyzing and manipulating data using SQL.
  • Ability to self-start and self-direct work in an unstructured and fast-paced environment. Comfort dealing with ambiguity
  • Demonstrated ability to identify and develop multifaceted relationships that span across organizations and holistically solve key organizational challenges.
  • Excellent communication skills; ability to influence executive-level clients effectively.
responsibilities:
• Work with company leadership to define, launch, and drive critical strategic, organizational, and operational initiatives around hiring.
  • Research and analyze key hiring growth drivers.
  • Leverage client-facing skills with a flexible communication style; communicate complex concepts and analytics in a structured manner.
  • Manage strategic initiatives on both an on-going and ad-hoc basis, working collaboratively across the global organization.
title: Strategy and Analytics Associate, People Operations
